Denial of Service.description: An attacker can make your authentication system unusable or unavailable.
Denial of Service.OWASP ASVS: V4.2 Ensure authentication mechanisms can resist DoS attacks.

Denial of Service.description: An attacker can drain our easily replaceable battery.
Denial of Service.OWASP ASVS: V4.7 Protect against battery draining attacks.

Denial of Service.description: An attacker can drain a battery that's hard to replace (sealed in a phone, an implanted medical device, or in a hard to reach location).
Denial of Service.OWASP ASVS: V4.7 Ensure device integrity with difficult-to-replace batteries.

Denial of Service.description: An attacker can spend our cloud budget.
Denial of Service.OWASP ASVS: V2.9 Monitor and control cloud-based resources usage.

Denial of Service.description: An attacker can make a server unavailable or unusable without ever authenticating but the problem goes away when the attacker stops.
Denial of Service.OWASP ASVS: V4.1 Protect against network flooding attacks.

Denial of Service.description: An attacker can make a client unavailable or unusable and the problem persists after the attacker goes away.
Denial of Service.OWASP ASVS: V4.10 Ensure client stability even after DoS attacks cease.

Denial of Service.description: An attacker can make a server unavailable or unusable and the problem persists after the attacker goes away.
Denial of Service.OWASP ASVS: V4.11 Design services to recover from DoS attacks.

Denial of Service.description: An attacker can make a client unavailable or unusable without ever authenticating and the problem persists after the attacker goes away.
Denial of Service.OWASP ASVS: V4.10 Ensure robust client-side attack recovery mechanisms.

Denial of Service.description: An attacker can make a server unavailable or unusable without ever authenticating and the problem persists after the attacker goes away.
Denial of Service.OWASP ASVS: V4.11 Implement mechanisms to recover server functionality post-attack.

Denial of Service.description: An attacker can cause the logging subsystem to stop working.
Denial of Service.OWASP ASVS: V7.8 Ensure logging systems are resilient to tampering and DoS.

Denial of Service.description: An attacker can amplify a Denial of Service attack through this component with amplification on the order of 10 to 1.
Denial of Service.OWASP ASVS: V4.13 Prevent amplification in component-based DoS attacks.

Denial of Service.description: An attacker can amplify a Denial of Service attack through this component with amplification on the order of 100 to 1.
Denial of Service.OWASP ASVS: V4.13 Mitigate DoS amplification factors in server components.

Denial of Service.description: An attacker overloads the authentication server with excessive login requests, causing a service slowdown for legitimate users.
Denial of Service.OWASP ASVS: V2.1.6 Ensure rate limiting is applied to all high-risk endpoints.

Denial of Service.description: A threat actor sends malformed packets to an IoT device, causing it to reboot repeatedly and drain its battery.
Denial of Service.OWASP ASVS: V4.7 Ensure IoT devices are protected against malformed inputs.

Denial of Service.description: An attacker exploits a vulnerability in the application's image processing library to cause a server crash by uploading specially crafted images.
Denial of Service.OWASP ASVS: V5.3 Ensure server-side validation of uploaded images to prevent crashes.

Denial of Service.description: An attacker repeatedly uses an API key reset feature with forged requests, causing excessive consumption of system resources.
Denial of Service.OWASP ASVS: V4.1.2 Control resource usage per user to prevent abuse.

Denial of Service.description: A distributed botnet performs a credential stuffing attack on a public-facing API, leading to service degradation.
Denial of Service.OWASP ASVS: V2.1.10 Protect APIs from credential stuffing and brute force attacks.

Denial of Service.description: A hacker disrupts a financial service application by triggering continuous transaction rollbacks through database locking.
Denial of Service.OWASP ASVS: V8.3 Ensure proper transaction handling to prevent application-level DoS.

Denial of Service.description: An attacker induces a race condition by making concurrent, conflicting configuration changes, causing system instability.
Denial of Service.OWASP ASVS: V11.5 Verify that applications handle race conditions safely.

Denial of Service.description: Through DNS amplification, an attacker floods an organization's servers with DNS response traffic, overwhelming network capacity.
Denial of Service.OWASP ASVS: V4.13 Protect against DNS amplification attacks by securing DNS servers.

Denial of Service.description: An attacker uses session fixation to create thousands of invalid sessions on an e-commerce site, consuming server resources.
Denial of Service.OWASP ASVS: V3.7 Ensure robust session management to prevent fixation.

Denial of Service.description: Malicious scripts are injected into a web application, causing endless loops that freeze user browsers and exhaust client resources.
Denial of Service.OWASP ASVS: V1.11 Ensure client-side input validation to prevent DoS attacks.
